title: Brain Imaging Techniques
subject: Neuroimaging
description: Learn about different brain imaging methods and their applications
notes: CT is fast and used for detecting bleeding
PET shows brain activity using radioactive tracers
fMRI measures brain activity by detecting blood flow
EEG records electrical activity of the brain

flashcards.back: Magnetic Resonance Imaging, detailed structural images
Computed Tomography, fast imaging, often for bleeding
Positron Emission Tomography, shows brain activity
Functional MRI, detects blood flow changes in brain
Used in PET to measure metabolism or activity
Early imaging technique, less detailed for brain
